image.altText: A stylised 3D graphic showing a dotted line connecting Tasmania and Victoria.

props.synopsis: One thing finally unites Labor, the Greens and the new independent members of Tasmania's parliament — frustration over the time allowed to digest a $5 billion investment decision on Marinus Link.

title.children: 'I won't be bullied': Labor leader given a day to support $5 billion Marinus decision

image.altText: An old man with a mask and scarf, two young women and another gentlemen with a face covering walk into a court building.

props.synopsis: A former student, appearing as a witness in the trial of Keith Bates-Willie, said no action was taken when he presented the school principal with a recording of the teacher allegedly speaking inappropriately with students.

title.children: Witness secretly recorded former Hobart teacher, court hears

image.altText: Zoomed-in image of a helicopter as it strikes water.

props.synopsis: An incident in which a helicopter crew disagreed before the aircraft hit a lake due to pilot miscalculation was not reported to safety authorities, in breach of regulations.

title.children: Helicopter near-miss unreported until bystander video sent to ATSB

image.altText: Dean Winter on Metro bus  2025-06-08 10:06:00

props.synopsis: If Tasmanian Labor leader Dean Winter was hoping for an endorsement from voters, the recent election could hardly have gone worse — now, it is looking increasingly difficult for him to find a way forward without the Greens' help.

title.children: Tasmanian Labor's Winter boxed in by 'no deal with Greens' stance

image.altText: Cheyanne Taylor Logan-Radford at Launceston Magistrates Court 2025-06-30

props.synopsis: A magistrate has implored a Tasmanian mother to turn her life around after she was given a suspended prison sentence for negligent driving that caused the death of her son.

title.children: Mother sentenced for crash that killed toddler son

image.altText: A small boy holds a white sack over his right shoulder while people walk past on a dusty road between tents.

props.synopsis: Gazans say they have to risk their lives in the hope of collecting aid at sites run by the Gaza Humanitarian Foundation, where nearly 800 people have been shot and killed.

title.children: 'If you're visible, we shoot': The Gazans torn between food or death

image.altText: Cost of living image of old hand holding cash with bills, calculator, glasses and cup of tea

props.synopsis: The "trimmed mean" measure of inflation — the Reserve Bank's preferred measure of underlying inflation — has also declined.

title.children: Latest inflation figures make rates cut 'increasingly likely', economists say

image.altText: The ASX building exterior.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has finished the day higher following the release of official data showing inflation continuing to ease, increasing the high likelihood of a rate cut in August.

title.children: ASX rises as falling inflation boosts RBA rate-cut hopes — as it happened

image.altText: couple carrying moving boxes

props.synopsis: When looking to buy a new home to live in, you might be wondering if it's best to sell your current property first. Both options have advantages and risks, experts explain.

title.children: Should you sell your existing property before buying another?

image.altText: Anthony Albanese G7

props.synopsis: In a joint statement with 14 countries including several who already recognise a Palestinian state, Australia welcomed a series of commitments by the Palestinian Authority which could pave the way to recognition.

title.children: Australia yet to recognise Palestine but signs fresh statement toughening its position

image.altText: A man carrying a rifle hanging from one hand walks across concrete, with a yellow square added around him.

props.synopsis: Shane Tamura, the gunman who killed four people inside a New York office this week before turning the gun on himself, was carrying a handwritten note in his wallet claiming he had CTE. What does that mean?

title.children: The NYC gunman left a note to 'study my brain' for CTE. What does it mean?

image.altText: People sitting on lounge chairs under umbrellas at a beach bar.

props.synopsis: Beach bars are set to become permanent at Broadbeach in 2026 but recovery efforts to fix the city's eroded beaches are expected to take years.

title.children: 'You actually need to have a beach': Gold Coast beach bar plan concerns

image.altText: A fire truck and firefighters.

props.synopsis: A man has been arrested for his alleged role in the December 2024 arson of the Adass Israel Synagogue of Melbourne in the city's inner south-east.

title.children: Overseas links probed in Melbourne synagogue arson attack as man arrested

image.altText: A man in a blue suit with media microphones in front of him.

props.synopsis: The family of a 95-year-old woman who was tasered by a police officer in an aged care home say they are "struggling to come to terms" with the non-custodial sentence.

title.children: Family of 95yo tasered by ex-cop 'struggling' to understand how he can 'walk free'

image.altText: Australian-made rocket crashes shortly after launch

props.synopsis: Gilmour Space Technologies attempted to launch its rocket from a spaceport in the north Queensland community of Bowen in an Australian-first on Wednesday morning.

title.children: Australian-made rocket crashes after attempted north Queensland launch

image.altText: Cash on a table

props.synopsis: More than 800,000 banking customers are eligible for refunds totalling $60 million. Here's what to know about the refunds and whether you're eligible.

title.children: Who is eligible for a share of $60 million in bank refunds?

image.altText: A forensics officer takes photos of the smashed entrance to BodyCare

props.synopsis: A man in his 30s is assisting police with their enquiries following a serious incident at a health club in the regional WA town.

title.children: Two taken to hospital as police investigate serious incident at Albany gym

image.altText: Sarah Gigante sprays champagne while standing on a podium wearing a cycling jersey.

props.synopsis: As the Tour de France Femmes heads into the mountains for the first time on stage five, Australian climber Sarah Gigante may just be getting started.

title.children: As the Tour de France Femmes road goes up, Sarah Gigante rises to the top

image.altText: Two men sit on a stage wearing t-shirts and jeans.

props.synopsis: Atlassian co-founder Scott Farquhar believes Australia can become one of the world's major data centre hubs, powered by renewable energy.

title.children: Atlassian founder spruiks Australian data centre hub

image.altText: A smartphone with the YouTube logo, with the website in the background behind it.

props.synopsis: The prime minister vows not to be intimidated by Google, as the tech giant threatens to sue over the government's decision to ban YouTube for children under 16.

title.children: Labor says Google 'sharks' won't scare it from banning YouTube for under 16s

image.altText: Anthony Albanese Sussan Ley

props.synopsis: Both Anthony Albanese and Sussan Ley are past convenors of the Parliamentary Friends of Palestine group when they were backbenchers, more than two decades ago.

title.children: Albanese and Ley were 'friends of Palestine'. What has shifted since?

image.altText: A minibus surrounded by trees and emergency workers.

props.synopsis: Six people are taken to hospital after a minibus rolled 50 metres down an embankment on the way to a wedding.

title.children: Groom one of two critical after minibus crash in Hunter Valley

image.altText: Cars are parked in front of the Aboriginal Tent Embassy

props.synopsis: One of the first Indigenous barristers in New South Wales is being remembered for his devoted commitment to bettering the lives of First Nations people. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised that this story contains the name and image of a person who has died.

title.children: Prominent Aboriginal rights activist and lawyer dies aged 76

image.altText: Aerial shot of a  large oil tanker gliding into harbour.

props.synopsis: A tanker believed to be carrying fuel derived from Russian oil docks in Western Australia, with question marks surrounding the cargo exposing glaring loopholes in the government's sanctions against Moscow.

title.children: Potential arrival of Russian-tainted fuel raises 'tricky' questions over sanctions

image.altText: School children in uniform.

props.synopsis: Queensland teachers at the state's 1,266 public schools will strike next Wednesday after protracted enterprise bargaining negotiations with the government.

title.children: Decision by Queensland teachers to strike 'not taken lightly', union says

image.altText: A man points at a cupcake in front of a plate of cupcakes in a kitchen

props.synopsis: The Great Australian Bake Off tent is not the first place you would expect to see comedian/mime/Twitch streamer Tom Walker but his latest transformation might just be his most impressive yet.

title.children: Tom Walker's parents couldn't believe he landed a gig as Bake Off co-host

image.altText: A school bag with pens sticking out.

props.synopsis: The annual test of literacy and numeracy for students in years 3, 5, 7 and 9 shows some isolated improvements but largely stable results.

title.children: Analysts sound alarm on latest concerning NAPLAN results

image.altText: A CFA worker in front of a truck rollover

props.synopsis: The Hume Freeway has been reopened southbound following a fatal collision north-east of Seymour.

title.children: Hume Freeway reopened north of Seymour following fatal accident

image.altText: A satellite photo of a long, thin, curved island annotated to identify military facilities along its entire length.

props.synopsis: Intelligence reveals China has built island bases capable of launching nuclear bombers from the South China Sea.

title.children: China's nuclear bombers now 'within range of Australia' from South China Sea

image.altText: US president Donald Trump points into the distance while looking seriously at the camera

props.synopsis: The US president has given some of his most expansive public comments yet about his falling out with the convicted sex offender.

title.children: Trump says Epstein 'stole' young women, including Virginia Giuffre, from Mar-a-Lago

image.altText: Naomi wears a white top and leans against a wall in a headshot.

props.synopsis: A common welfare test has been labelled "prehistoric" and linked to financial abuse. So why is it so controversial?

title.children: Naomi says this welfare test is stopping her finding love

image.altText: Jack Silvagni carries the ball against Collingwood

props.synopsis: Collingwood coach Craig McRae confirms he has met with Jack Silvagni as Carlton's favourite son moves closer to a once-unthinkable switch to the Blues' fiercest rivals.

title.children: Magpies coach confirms 'first date' with Silvagni ahead of possible move

image.altText: Young girl lies on a dental chair with her mouth open, blue gloved hands use dental instruments in her mouth

props.synopsis: A new survey has found most Australian parents are unaware of when to take their children to the dentist for the first time.

title.children: National survey highlights parents' lack of understanding of baby teeth

image.altText: Steak, chops and pork on display in butcher's window

props.synopsis: The National Party wants an inquiry into the decision to lift biosecurity controls on US beef imports, claiming the federal government ignored its own scientific advice.

title.children: Nationals push for Senate inquiry into decision to resume US beef imports

image.altText: ATO Commissioner Chris Jordan speaks at the National Press Club.

props.synopsis: A decade ago the Australian Taxation Office traded people for programs in an effort to cut costs.

title.children: Australians don't know how the tax office is performing because the ATO doesn't know itself
